statements: SELECT * FROM production_quality_checks WHERE id = 1;
SELECT stage, check_type, check_result FROM production_quality_checks WHERE stage = 'Final Inspection';
SELECT id, stage, check_type, check_result FROM production_quality_checks ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT * FROM production_quality_checks WHERE check_result = TRUE AND stage = 'Assembly';
SELECT stage, COUNT(*) AS total_checks FROM production_quality_checks GROUP BY stage;
SELECT * FROM production_quality_checks WHERE check_result = TRUE ORDER BY stage DESC, id ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, stage, check_type FROM production_quality_checks WHERE stage IN ('Stage 1', 'Stage 2') ORDER BY id;
SELECT id, check_type FROM production_quality_checks WHERE stage = 'Final Stage' AND check_result = FALSE ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT stage, COUNT(*) AS total_checks FROM production_quality_checks GROUP BY stage HAVING total_checks > 10 ORDER BY total_checks DESC;
SELECT stage, AVG(CAST(check_result AS INT)) AS avg_check_result FROM production_quality_checks GROUP BY stage ORDER BY avg_check_result DESC;
SELECT * FROM QualityControlChecksStage1;
SELECT product_id, check_result FROM QualityControlChecksStage2;
SELECT check_date, product_id FROM QualityControlChecksStage1 WHERE check_result = 'Pass';
SELECT id, check_result FROM QualityControlChecksStage2 ORDER BY check_date DESC;
SELECT product_id FROM QualityControlChecksStage1 WHERE product_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM QualityControlChecksStage1 WHERE check_result = 'Pass';
SELECT product_id, check_date FROM QualityControlChecksStage2 WHERE product_id = 100 ORDER BY check_date DESC;
SELECT id, check_result FROM QualityControlChecksStage1 WHERE check_date >= '2022-01-01' AND check_result = 'Fail';
SELECT * FROM QualityControlChecksStage2 WHERE product_id IN (1, 2, 3) ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT product_id FROM QualityControlChecksStage1 WHERE check_result <> 'Pass';
SELECT * FROM production_stage1 LIMIT 5;
SELECT product_name, quality_check1 FROM production_stage2 WHERE quality_check2 = TRUE;
SELECT id, product_name FROM production_stage3 ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT * FROM production_stage1 WHERE quality_check1 = FALSE;
SELECT product_name, final_quality_check FROM production_stage3;
SELECT * FROM production_stage1 WHERE quality_check1 = TRUE
SELECT product_name, quality_check1 FROM production_stage1 WHERE product_name = 'ProductA'
SELECT * FROM production_stage2 WHERE quality_check2 = FALSE
SELECT product_name, final_quality_check FROM production_stage3 ORDER BY product_name DESC
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_products FROM production_stage1
SELECT id, product_name, check_result FROM ProductionStage1QualityCheck;
SELECT product_name, check_result, id FROM ProductionStage2QualityCheck;
SELECT product_name, check_result, issue_found, id FROM ProductionStage3QualityCheck ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, product_name, final_check_result, total_defects FROM OverallQualityReport WHERE final_check_result = TRUE;
SELECT id, product_name, check_result, issue_found, resolution FROM ProductionStage3QualityCheck WHERE issue_found = TRUE ORDER BY id;
SELECT * FROM ProductionStage1QualityCheck WHERE check_result = TRUE ORDER BY product_name ASC;
SELECT product_name, check_result FROM ProductionStage2QualityCheck WHERE issue_found = TRUE ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, product_name, resolution FROM ProductionStage3QualityCheck WHERE issue_found = FALSE AND check_result = TRUE;
SELECT product_name, final_check_result, total_defects FROM OverallQualityReport WHERE total_defects > 0 ORDER BY final_check_result DESC;
SELECT id, check_result FROM ProductionStage1QualityCheck WHERE id IN (1,2,3,4,5);
SELECT * FROM production_stage1_check;
SELECT check_name, check_result FROM production_stage2_check WHERE check_result=true;
SELECT id, check_result FROM production_stage3_check WHERE id=5;
SELECT * FROM production_stage4_check WHERE id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT id, check_name FROM production_stage5_check ORDER BY check_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM production_stage1_check WHERE check_result = TRUE LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, check_name FROM production_stage2_check WHERE check_name LIKE 'Check%' ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, check_result FROM production_stage3_check WHERE check_result = FALSE AND id > 100 ORDER BY id ASC;
SELECT * FROM production_stage4_check WHERE id BETWEEN 50 AND 100 OR check_name = 'Initial check';
SELECT id, check_name FROM production_stage5_check WHERE id % 2 = 0 ORDER BY id ASC LIMIT 10;
